analysis.purpose: To discuss media strategy regarding increasing journalist interest in Epstein's connections to presidential candidates
analysis.significance: Shows Epstein actively managing media narrative about his case and political connections during 2016 presidential campaign

notable_quotes: the more Trump looks real, or perish the thought, inevitable, the more reporters are going to focus on this, so, as you will not be surprised, you need a strategy.

red_flags: Media strategy discussions about criminal case

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this communication - appears to be media strategy discussion

details: ABC News investigative unit reporter Matthew Mosk seeking information
Discussion of media strategy for Epstein case coverage
Concern about increased reporter focus as Trump campaign gains momentum

public_knowledge.context: Epstein's connections to Clinton and Trump were widely reported in media. This email shows behind-the-scenes media strategy during the 2016 presidential campaign.

analysis.summary: Jeffrey Epstein and Michael Wolff discuss media strategy regarding increasing journalist interest in Epstein's connections to presidential candidates Clinton and Trump, with Wolff advising Epstein needs a strategy as Trump's campaign gains momentum and reporters focus more on the Epstein case.
